title: It's not WHAT you say, it's HOW YOU SAY IT
body:
and how good you look {{champion:154}}!

But seriously, I can't count how many times I've seen someone complaining that they were reported for just "telling our top laner to play safe" or "asking the jungler to gank" or "suggesting the support buy sightstone".
But the people who say this are **completely missing the point.**
You didn't get chat restricted for giving advice, you got restricted for being an ass about it.

There is a world of difference between saying:
   "Hey [support] we don't have vision on dragon, can you ward it?"
and
   "IF YOU DONT WARD DRAGON, YOU'RE FUKCING WORTHLESS"

**It's not just about what you say, it's how you say it.**

It's totally fine to tell your top laner to play safe, but "stop feeding noob" is not good advice.
After losing a teamfight saying "that was a bad fight" isn't toxic behavior, but "WELL, fuck all of you, you guys just threw the goddamn game!" is.
Asking for a jungle gank is actually a GOOD thing, but if you don't get one and start spamming "GG trash jungle never ganks" then guess what?
You're gonna get reported. 

I'm sure most people understand this, but it's common enough to see people playing innocent about negative behavior, that I felt a blanket post was needed.

replies.body:
"It's totally fine to tell your top laner to play safe"
No it isn't, l2toplane. Playing safe means giving up lane control and cs, letting the enemy laner push to your tower where you can either stay and get dived or back off and lose your tower when the enemy jungler comes. And if your jungler can't secure dragon 4v3 then you've just lost a tower for free. Playing "safe" in toplane isn't like playing safe in midlane. Especially if you're behind and can't get deep wards into the enemy jungle. You can get ganked from the lane brushes or dived from behind your tower if you let the lane just sit at your tower without jungle pressure. Unless your jungler knows that and is willing to give up dragon control to keep you safe then playing "safe" is just about the stupidest thing you can do in toplane.

Sure, if your botlane and midlane are powerspiking or just ahead in gold then you can secure dragon with a 1-man advantage, but usually the best you'll get is to clear their wards and set up your own, and that's not as good as a tower.
Yeah, go ahead, dont play safe against the 5/0/0 {{champion:122}} , see how that works out for ya

If he's 5-0-0 then him and the jungler can safely dive you anyway. It's smarter to push the lane and go take jungle camps or try to TP bot. Not laning at all. Playing "safe" and letting him get a big wave where he can harass you under tower with his Q and dive when the jungler comes is still the stupidest option.

*Push the lane*
Yep and 5/0 Darius is going to sit there and watch you push the lane.
http://i.imgur.com/3mLydMU.png

Um, yeah? Even if you're a 0-5 Shyvana just press W, shove the lane in seconds and if he tries something press R and you'll be perfectly safe. He just can't chase you. If you're Sion, then do the same. Almost every competitively viable toplaner has ways of pushing the lane and getting away safely, even if behind. Besides, 5-0-0 is a bit extreme, you'll be lucky to see more than 1-2 kills top in the first 25 mins.

I think he can probably shove something in you faster than you can shove the lane.

Also, what can you do when your ult is down?

Not really, both Shyvana and Sion are tanky as fuck, Shyv gets free resists and just stacks HP, Sion gets that shield and HP from W and just stacks resists. If you shove in a Darius he has to use a lot of mana to shove that lane back and if he just decides to freeze it you go for a dragon play and tp back top. Shyvana doesn't have manacosts and Sion's are very low so they can keep that lane pushed without running oom. 
Also, darius doesn't have a gapcloser, he can't chase you through creeps.

> [{quoted}](name=Frikgeek,realm=EUNE,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=uvZuPhqa,comment-id=0002000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-06T22:20:27.588+0000)
he has to use a lot of mana to shove that lane back

I'm pretty sure one Q is enough to murder most of the minion wave, especially if he is 5/0/0 as stated above.

Not like you should be building damage on Darius, but you can pick up a Frozen heart if you're ahead so mana is less of an issue. 1 Darius Q at lvl 9 will do 315 damage if you connect with the edge. With some bonus AD you might be able to oneshot ranged creeps but not melee creeps. You'll need 2 Qs to re-push the wave or you could just settle for freezing it but that lets the opponent roam freely.
If the minion wave isn't dead, he can just AA them a few times, then they are dead.

What do you do when he cancels your ult with E and burnout is on cooldown because you used it to push the wave? Aside from die in a few seconds because tank stats don't mean much if you're 5 deaths to your enemy laners 5 kills.
If jungle ganks the dunk. You both will ride the dunk train.
Cuz dunktown dunk gon' dunk it on ya!

as a Darius main... I must say me with 5/0/0 normally means a {{item:3074}}  {{item:1001}}  {{item:3141}} , cause at that point I can just shred you with my Q and have you running under tower where I will. take you down right when you go for the caster minions by pulling you with E then hitting you with W then as you try to run Q at the perfect time. ignite for good messure. turn and walk away... and you die two to three seconds later.
{{champion:75}}
And that's why Nasus isn't viable.

A Nasus LOVES being pushed to tower.

Although I was going to make a snarky response, but I opted for just posting Susan. Also, you are incorrect. Top laners snowball too, and sometimes you have to lose out on cs and lane control to avoid letting them get too ahead. There's a difference between not winning lane and losing it, you know. And that makes all the difference.

Yeah, well, maybe you wreck people with Nasus in silver 4 and maybe people play toplaners that aren't farming supertanks but that doesn't happen in competitive or high elo play. Toplane is all about cs and pressure, kills happen when your jungler ganks or if you pick Riven or Fiora, both of which nobody likes having on their team as you'll need tankyness from your support or jungler.
sirhcEz called. He would like to have a word with you.

A diamond 2 guy with 3 nasus games. Oh yeah, that totally proves everything. Sure, he was master in S4 with a 51% winratio on Nasus, but this isn't Season 4. Nasus was actually a viable pick before smiting people for true damage while reducing their damage by 20% was a thing. Red smite means you can bully Nasus around even harder in Season 5.  The new dragon buff which is also a much more serious lategame threat and you can't just trade dragon gold for towers+cs so a champion like Nasus who can't help securing those early drakes(due to his weak earlygame and reliance on farm) even with TP just isn't very effective.

The post is quite literally trying to tell people to say things in a less toxic, more friendly way, and here you are, flaming people and bringing ranks into the argument.

Just please, no need to get angry and whine about how a champion isn't strong because they don't follow a certain behavior. There's strategy in all things, whether it be in game or with words.
So you're in bronze.....right?
If you look closely you'll notice that's a S4 master tier icon I'm using. Sooo, yeah.
If you look closely, top lane isn't your place :)

I main it. Just because you think that playing passive is in any way "safe" in higher elo doesn't change that. Actual safety comes from pressure on the map and a creepwave that the enemy toplaner has to run through(thus signifying that you're being ganked) and of course, picking champs that either have stupid amounts of escapes or are tanky as fuck. Usually you'll want both in your go-to meta toplaner. 
The time to be passive is when the creepwave is right at the enemy tower, if it's near yours you can freeze it but remain aggressive enough so that the enemy toplaner can't simply shove it into your tower and make you easily divable.

What most people mean when they say that you should play "safe" is that you should play like a bitch and let them dive you.
Yet again, so am I, but that's what I get for having DJ Booty, MrHookYoGirl, and SpamHeals as my mains....

You sir, are a bad top. Play safe, wait for jungle. Dont be bronze.

Edit: K, so i actually just read all this guys responses and I seriously hope this is a troll. Dullards like this have cost me so many gdamn games in my time. Just keep dying based on w/e reason isnt good enough to continue dying...okay then. GL with that. I personally just farm and dont die at all. lol

You don't die at all? Don't lie kid, your stats say you die 5.4 times per game on average. Not to mention you're just barely silver, so you die to silvers. Playing "safe" or passively is basically giving up and letting the enemy get free kills or towers. A tower is worth like 3 kills in gold alone, the vision and map pressure you lose by losing towers is worth even more than that.
Wouldn't expect a silver like you to understand though.
Dude this community is so freaking noob toxic I have no idea what to say lol

I always forgot how stupid 'average intelligence' is. There is a significant portion of the league community that thinks that if your teammate is doing poorly, it's not toxic to flame them since "it's the truth".

"It's the truth" is virtually always a lie. At a minimum, it is a half truth. 

When someone say's "it's the truth" then what they are really saying is, "I know I just insulted you, and stated an opinion as if it were a fact, but I'm important and you are not. Therefore MY opinions are true and your opinions are just proof you are inferior to me."

It is an accurate gauge of narcissistic tendencies.

My favorite thing about these sorts of people is they really show the arrogance when you try to get them to be polite where they are usually unable to actually defend their behavior so they have to attack instead. "I'm not going to coddle that child, if they can't take it... Blahblahblah". So instead of taking responsibility for their own words, they insult the other person for being too fragile.

Doesn't matter how old the body gets, some people never grow up.
'Think of how stupid the average person is, and realize half of them are stupider than that.' - George Carlin
Up vote. Also then realize there is a decent chance you are close to that since the majority of the population is one standard deviation from the mean and the vast majority are less than 2.
no, dude. when game after game after game after game after game u see that one full ad/full ap idiot which ruins the game, u cannot say it nicely. U SIMPLY CANNOT

You can, actually.
Raging will NOT get a better response out of them than asking nicely.  If anything, they are MORE likely to not listen, just to spite you.

If nothing else, if you are seeing the same problems every game, think of something to say beforehand and copy/paste it when you see the problem if you can't stop yourself from raging when ad-libbing.

Being nice will also not get your win back, so why bother? Unlike what Riot wants you to believe, SoloQ ain't about being nice or who's actually skilled. It's about who won the biggest feeder lottery for that match.

I know it's rare, but I have seen a LOT of people who do poorly in lane, and come back to carry the team.
Not limited to late-game champs, but just as a player, they seem to have better team fight mechanics. If you rage, or fall into the mindset that nothing matters, than you throw the game away no matter what.

I have done this before, and it is usually when my team says things like "no problem, just play safe in laning and we can come back in the next big teamfight" not when my team says "GG Mid lane is trash, I knew I should have dodged, such a waste of my time". When your team is raging at you it makes it much harder to focus on the game and calm down and play well.
Good, don't want to play too long with a 2/9 jinx and a 0/9 thresh
God forbid someone has a bad game, or is new to a champion and could use advice, but no fuck them they shouldn't be playing.

When I want to learn a champion, I start with teambuilder, then normals and then ranked. I don't duo queue ranked and call bot lane with my tag along feeder and pick jinx/thresh cuz "lel most op bot lane, ggez".

Some people need a while to learn how to play champions, even after practicing in normal, and could use FRIENDLY advice to speed up the process.  But playing in normal isn't the same as playing ranked.  Normal is full of toxins, trolls, and people who don't care about anything.  Ranked players have an overarching goal of advancing ranks.  The best way to practice for ranked is to play ranked and at a certain level, a player who has little knowledge of  how to play a champion will lose to a player who does know how to play, and some asshole  belittling them won't help.

speaking positively towards your teamates will help many players stay on goal, and can make it more likely that they try to coordinate with you. being nice may not get you a win back post game, but during game it most definitely will help increase your odds of wining.

If a teammate fed during laning, chances are they have no items. No items mean they can't do their job and that means they are worthless. Giving them a kill will just reset the bounty so they can feed again.
Fun Fact: you can catch up even if you got behind early game! WOW!
Other fun fact : someone that can't realize they have sit back and farm because they fed 4 kills to the enemy ADC can't come back. They're not smart enough.

You're assuming that another lane could not have gotten fed, or that the enemy team is perfect in every way and won't slip up once.

Believe it or not, I have played games where I would stay bot lane, for example, and farm for 5-10 minutes just to catch up, while taking a tower as I go. I get more gold and still assist my team, despite being behind. The most important part of every game is to NEVER underestimate your opponent. Do that even once, and it could lose you the game.
Being a rager will also not get your win back, so why bother?

Easier to rage than being nice to avoid hurting a feeders feelings. If you do bad, I'll tell you and I won't be nice about it because I'm usually the one that has to make up for it and deal with what you caused.

So you want to be a jerk to someone who is unintentionally doing bad in a video game? They're probably more upset about their score than you are, and being toxic won't help them. I know that if I'm feeding I don't want anyone yelling at me, it'll just make me do worse.
